body.section:
Follow the steps below to compile and install Pluto
Prepare Environment
Download and Install a Java Development Kit release (version 1.3.1) from http://java.sun.com/j2se/
Install the JDK according to the instructions included with the release.
Set an environment variable JAVA_HOME to the pathname of the directory to which the JDK has been installed.
Download and Install the Tomcat 4.1 Binary Distribution from http://jakarta.apache.org/builds/jakarta-tomcat-4.1
Unpack the binary distribution into a convenient location so that the distribution resides in its own directory (conventionally named "jakarta-tomcat-4.1"). For the purposes of the remainder of this document, the symbolic name "${catalina.home}" is used to refer to the full pathname of the release directory.
Install Pluto
Download Pluto the latest source from the Jakarta Source index or directly from cvs. Place the source tree in a directory which will be referred to for the remainder of this document as ${pluto.home}.
From the command line, go to the ${pluto.hom}/build directory and call "build", if you need to completely rebuild you can use "build rebuild"
Call the "install" script (install.bat or install.sh). You will be asked to type the Path where Tomcat is installed
Start Up Tomcat 4.1. Please see Tomcat instructions for information
Run Pluto: Default url to start Pluto is http://localhost:8080/pluto/portal
In case Tomcat runs on a different port, change the port setting in ${catalina.home}/webapps/pluto/WEB-INF/config/services/ConfigService.properties
Install Portlets
To install portlets after you successfully installed Pluto, copy the portlet war's to the ${pluto.home}/portlets directory and execute ${pluto.home}/build/build.bat deploy_portlets .
